metadata.title: CVE-2015-8385 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
PCRE before 8.38 mishandles the /(?|(\k'Pm')|(?'Pm'))/ pattern and relatedpatterns with certain forward references, which allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (buffer overflow) or possibly have unspecifiedother impact via a crafted regular expression, as demonstrated by aJavaScript RegExp object encountered by Konqueror.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8385` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcre16-3 - 2:8.38-3
libpcre3 - 2:8.38-3
libpcre32-3 - 2:8.38-3
libpcrecpp0v5 - 2:8.38-3
pcregrep - 2:8.38-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pcre3 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:8.38-3').
